page.title: 12CHURCH ARCHITECTURE
page.content: The oldest remaining part of Shareshill church is the l4th century tower;the body of the church long and narrow,with an apse forming the sanctuary is l8th century,as are the altar rails and painted royal arms.The font and east window are dated l86l.Painted boards carry the Commandments,the Creed,the Lords Prayer and a list of parish charities.The valuable l6th century altar plate is kept at the bank. Alabaster effigies of Sir Humphrey Swynnerton and his wife Cassandra dated l562 are at the east end of the church. From l86O-l87O William Henry Havergal, hymnwriter and composer and Hon.Canon of Worcester Cathedral,held the living of Shareshill.He composed the tune "Consecration" for the hymn written by his daughter,Frances Ridley Havergal, "Take my life and let it be".
